meanings.definition: Occurring before reaching the final stage or point.
meanings.sent1: The preterminal phase of the project involved planning and preparation.
meanings.sent2: The preterminal bus stop is just before the main station.
meanings.sent3: The preterminal excitement before the party made everyone eager to arrive.
meanings.sent4: Her preterminal decision to leave the job shocked her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The preterminal warning signs of the storm prompted people to take shelter.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is in the stage before reaching the final point.
meanings.sent1: The preterminal of the race was leading by a small margin.
meanings.sent2: The preterminal in the queue was anxiously waiting for their turn.
meanings.sent3: The preterminal of the movie kept the audience guessing until the end.
meanings.sent4: She was the preterminal in the family to graduate from college.
meanings.sent5: The preterminal of the marathon was determined to finish strong.
